subject: Additional Pure Mathematics
syllabus: OCR A Level Further Mathematics A

questions.text: The sequence {u_n} is defined by u_0 = 2, u_1 = 5 and u_n = (1 + u_{n-1}) / u_{n-2} for n ≥ 2. Prove that the sequence is periodic with period 5.
Determine f_x, f_y, f_xx, f_yy, f_xy and f_yx.
questions.scenario: A surface has equation z = f(x, y) where f(x, y) = x^2 sin y + 2y cos x.

questions.text: Verify that z has a stationary point at (1/2 ̃π, 1/2 ̃π, 1/4 π^2).
questions.scenario: A surface has equation z = f(x, y) where f(x, y) = x^2 sin y + 2y cos x.

questions.text: Determine the nature of this stationary point.
questions.scenario: A surface has equation z = f(x, y) where f(x, y) = x^2 sin y + 2y cos x.

questions.text: Solve 7x ≡ 6 (mod 19).
Show that the following simultaneous linear congruences have no solution: x ≡ 3 (mod 4), x ≡ 4 (mod 6).
Solve the second-order recurrence relation T_{n+2} + 2T_n = -87 given that T_0 = -27 and T_1 = 27.
Determine the value of T_{20}.
By constructing the Cayley table for G, determine all the elements of S.
questions.scenario: The group G consists of a set S together with x_80, the operation of multiplication modulo 80. It is given that S is the smallest set which contains the element 11.

questions.text: Use the two Cayley tables to explain why G and H are not isomorphic.
questions.context: The student has already constructed a table for G in 5(a).

questions.text: List all the proper subgroups of G, and all the proper subgroups of H.
Use your answers to (c) (i) to give another reason why G and H are not isomorphic.
For the vectors p = [1, 2, 3], q = [3, 1, -1] and r = [2, -4, 5], calculate: p ⋅ q × r, p × (q × r), (p × q) × r.
State whether the vector product is associative for three-dimensional column vectors with real components. Justify your answer.
Explain geometrically why the vector a × (b × c) must be expressible in the form λb + μc, where λ and μ are scalar constants.
questions.scenario: It is given that a, b and c are three-dimensional column vectors with real components.

questions.text: Find an expression for (a × b) × c in the form of (*), where (*) is a × (b × c) = (a ⋅ c) b - (a ⋅ b) c.
questions.scenario: It is given that the following relationship holds for a, b and c: a × (b × c) = (a ⋅ c) b - (a ⋅ b) c (*)

questions.text: Find the exact value of A. Give your answer as a rational multiple of π.
questions.scenario: The points P(1/2, 13/24) and Q(3/2, 31/24) lie on the curve y = (1/3)x^3 + 1/(4x). The area of the surface generated when arc PQ is rotated completely about the x-axis is denoted by A.

questions.text: Find the approximation to A obtained by student X. Give your answer as a rational multiple of π.
questions.scenario: Student X finds an approximation to A by modelling the arc PQ as the straight line segment PQ, then rotating this line segment completely about the x-axis to form a surface.

questions.text: Find the approximation to A obtained by student Y. Give your answer correct to four decimal places.
questions.scenario: Student Y finds a second approximation to A by modelling the original curve as the line y = M, where M is the mean value of the function f(x) = (1/3)x^3 + 1/(4x), then rotating this line completely about the x-axis to form a surface.

groups.title: Number Theory Proofs

questions.text: Prove that 2(p - 2)^{p-2} ≡ -1 (mod p), where p is an odd prime.
Find two odd prime factors of the number N = 2 × 34^34 - 2^15.

groups.instructions: In this question you must show detailed reasoning.
